reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Zimmerbrau is a fantastic hotel, it is extremely well run with excellent friendly staff and nothing seems too much trouble for them. We booked the hotel through Inghams and initially had a problem when we arrived as we had booked a south facing room whereas we were allocated a very small room (north facing) just over the reception - however very quickly this was rectified and just after breakfast on our second day there we were moved into a new room - which was large and very nice.

reviews.text: The hotel also has its own summerhouse which is available to guests just a few minutes walk from the hotel - this was a great facility to use with sun loungers, etc, and meant that we didn't have to pay to use a public bathing area (although the water in Lake Wolfgang is very cold!!)

reviews.title: Far better than 3 Star
reviews.text: We would definitely stay in this hotel if we were to return to St Wolfgang.

My husband and I and another couple have just returned from a wonderful two week stay at the Hotel Zimmerbrau. The owners Alex and Hans are so very friendly and can't do enough for you. The hotel has recently been very tastefully redecorated and our room was so spacious, it was one of the best we have ever stayed in! The buffet breakfast always has a wide range of choices as does the four course evening meal, it is excellent value. The hotel is situated in the middle of the town and there is always something going on, Saturdays and Wednesdays there is a band concert in the square which creates a wonderful atmosphere. The scenery all round is breathtaking, there is certainly something for all ages in the area. We certainly hope to go back again one day. We were very fortunate with the weather and saw Austria at it's best in the sunshine. Thank you Alex and Hans for a lovely holiday and hope to see you again!
reviews.title: Family Friendly

reviews.text: We stayed here over New Year and I can not fault the hotel. It was very clean and homely, the owners were very friendly and were able to advise us about where to go etc. The food was nice, always hot and a good variety even serving free tea / coffee with your evening ,eal which was nice. If you are a light sleeper though ask for a room away from the front or back of the hotel as the local church has it bells peeling all through the night every hour and then every 15 minutes from about 6AM. The resort itself is VERY quiet over New Year. Once the little advent huts have been taken down which is usually on New Years day the only shops that seemed to be open were the 2 small supermarkets. New Years Eve itself was dissappointing with a few people gathered in the main square but maybe this is because it is a bank holiday and many of the locals do go away. New Years day and 6th Jan are both bank holidays there and literally nothing is open, the buses do still run though but even the bigger resorts like Bad Ischl are completley closed, i would recommend maybe going up to the Postalm on these days just for something to do. If you like walking then there are lots of walks to do and the scenery is stunning. The people are very friendly and there are a few nice local bars that open late. Overall it was a great holiday and very relaxing but just be prepared if its a bank holiday expecially at catholic relgious times for the small resort to be shut down.
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.disliked: — the local church being so close with its bells chiming all night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a brilliant little hotel which deserves more than its three star rating. The rooms are very comfortable and the food very good indeed. Complimentary tea and coffee are served in the lounge at four and this is a good place to meet fellow guests. It's a small hotel and everyone is extremely friendly. sadly the main talking point when we were there was the incessant rain. We walk regularly in the Lake District and have all the correct gear but nevertheless after three days relented and bought an umbrella. We still enjoyed ourselves as we are used to walking in all types of weather but I felt so sorry for the many older couples who had hoped for leisurely trips across the lakes and "Kaffee und Kuchen" at one of the many open air cafes. We saw from the postcards how beautiful the area is - just as well because there was no opportunity to take any photos.
reviews.title: loved the hotel shame about the weather

likes.disliked: — drinks in the bar were expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay in St. Wolfgang and found the Hotel Zimmerbrau to be cosy, comfortable and a great base from which to enjoy our travels. The owners, Alexandra and Hans, and their staff made us feel entirely at home and couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. The food was great and plentiful. We have vowed to return to St Wolfgang and will certainly stay at the Zimmerbrau.
reviews.title: A Home From Home

reviews.text: This is a brilliant, family run hotel. It is all newly refurbished and in a traditional way. All the bannister rails, doors and skirtings are natural wood which gives it almost a log cabin feel. It has lovely little seating areas on each floor's landing with antique-style easy-chairs and sofas and cute little things like teddies in a little crib, and wooden side boards. The family who run it are very friendly. The food is self service but there is a choice of two main courses and desserts for evening meal, and the food is quite good. The rooms are to a very high standard and very comfortable. They also have balconies with a nice view of the mountains. In the hotel bar on an evening there are games like connect four, dominoes, cards, scrabble etc that you can play (although be warned, some have pieces missing!) and there is a little bell to tinkle for service!
reviews.title: Fabulous homely feel!

likes.liked: — The warm decor and friendly atmosphere

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.text: St Wolfgang itself is a beautiful place, very scenic. We had a twin-centre with Salzburg, which worked well. In May the weather was wet, but it did not stop us going on mountain walks and scenic lakeside walks. There are lots of well marked trails. In the town itself there are lots of craft style shops selling things like tradiional Austrian costumes and cuckoo clocks, which are nice to look round. The only thing the rain spoiled was the cog railway that takes you up one of the mountains - it was rain on the ground but snow at the top so the train could not operate. However, going when there was still snow on the top of the mountains did make the scenery more spectacular. However, if rain bothers you, I would probably recommend going in the summer (although it is a mountain climates so showers are possible all year).
